verses.kjv: And Moses answered and said, But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, The LORD hath not appeared unto thee.
verses.ct: But Moses replied, "What if they don't believe me or listen to what I say? They'll claim, 'The LORD never appeared to you.'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, What is that in thine hand? And he said, A rod.
verses.ct: The LORD asked him, "What are you holding?" Moses answered, "A staff."

verses.kjv: And he said, Cast it on the ground. And he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moses fled from before it.
verses.ct: God said, "Throw it on the ground." So Moses threw it down, and it turned into a snake. Moses ran from it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Put forth thine hand, and take it by the tail. And he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand:
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Reach out and grab it by the tail." Moses reached out, took hold of it, and it turned back into a staff in his hand.

verses.kjv: That they may believe that the LORD God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath appeared unto thee.
verses.ct: "This is so they will be convinced that the LORD, the God of their ancestors — the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob — really did appear to you."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said furthermore unto him, Put now thine hand into thy bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous as snow.
verses.ct: The LORD also told him, "Now put your hand inside your robe." Moses slipped his hand inside his robe, and when he pulled it out, look — his hand was covered with a skin disease, white as snow.

verses.kjv: And he said, Put thine hand into thy bosom again. And he put his hand into his bosom again; and plucked it out of his bosom, and, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.
verses.ct: Then God said, "Put your hand back inside your robe." Moses put his hand back in, and when he pulled it out again, it was restored — healthy like the rest of his skin.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.
verses.ct: "If they don't believe you or respond to the first sign, then the second sign should convince them."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.
verses.ct: "But if they still refuse to believe even after both signs and won't listen to you, then take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground. The water you take from the river will turn to blood on the ground."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, O my LORD, I am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant: but I am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.
verses.ct: Moses said to the LORD, "Please, Lord, I've never been a good speaker — not in the past, and not even now that you've been talking to your servant. I'm clumsy with words and slow to express myself."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Who hath made man’s mouth? or who maketh the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not I the LORD?
verses.ct: The LORD responded, "Who gave humans the ability to speak? Who makes a person unable to speak, or deaf, or able to see, or blind? Isn't it I, the LORD?"

verses.kjv: Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.
verses.ct: "So go! I will help you speak and will tell you exactly what to say."

verses.kjv: And he said, O my LORD, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send.
verses.ct: But Moses said, "Please, Lord — send someone else instead."

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Moses, and he said, Is not Aaron the Levite thy brother? I know that he can speak well. And also, behold, he cometh forth to meet thee: and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart.
verses.ct: At this, the LORD became angry with Moses and said, "What about your brother Aaron the Levite? I know he speaks well. In fact, he's already on his way to meet you, and he'll be thrilled to see you."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
verses.ct: "You will speak to him and give him the words to say. I will help both of you speak and will show you both what to do."

verses.kjv: And he shall be thy spokesman unto the people: and he shall be, even he shall be to thee instead of a mouth, and thou shalt be to him instead of God.
verses.ct: "He will be your spokesperson to the people. He will serve as your mouth, and you will be like God to him, directing what he says."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take this rod in thine hand, wherewith thou shalt do signs.
verses.ct: "And take this staff with you — you will use it to perform the signs."

verses.kjv: And Moses went and returned to Jethro his father in law, and said unto him, Let me go, I pray thee, and return unto my brethren which are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
verses.ct: Moses went back to his father-in-law Jethro and said, "Please let me return to my people in Egypt to see if any of them are still alive." Jethro told Moses, "Go with my blessing."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt: for all the men are dead which sought thy life.
verses.ct: While still in Midian, the LORD told Moses, "Go back to Egypt, because all the men who wanted to kill you are dead."

verses.kjv: And Moses took his wife and his sons, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt: and Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
verses.ct: So Moses took his wife and sons, put them on a donkey, and headed back to Egypt. He carried the staff of God in his hand.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, When thou goest to return into Egypt, see that thou do all those wonders before Pharaoh, which I have put in thine hand: but I will harden his heart, that he shall not let the people go.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "When you get back to Egypt, make sure you perform all the miraculous signs I've given you in front of Pharaoh. But I will make his heart stubborn, and he will refuse to let the people go."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say unto Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD, Israel is my son, even my firstborn:
verses.ct: "Then tell Pharaoh, 'This is what the LORD says: Israel is my son, my firstborn."

verses.kjv: And I say unto thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.
verses.ct: "I told you to let my son go so he can worship me. But since you refuse to release him, I will kill your son — your firstborn.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the LORD met him, and sought to kill him.
verses.ct: During the journey, at a place where they stopped for the night, the LORD confronted Moses and was about to kill him.

verses.kjv: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it at his feet, and said, Surely a bloody husband art thou to me.
verses.ct: Zipporah quickly grabbed a sharp stone, cut off her son's foreskin, and touched it to Moses' feet. She said, "You are a husband of blood to me!"

verses.kjv: So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.
verses.ct: So the LORD let him alone. She had said "husband of blood" because of the circumcision.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went, and met him in the mount of God, and kissed him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the LORD told Aaron, "Go out into the wilderness to meet Moses." So Aaron went and found him at the mountain of God, and he embraced him.

verses.kjv: And Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD who had sent him, and all the signs which he had commanded him.
verses.ct: Moses told Aaron everything the LORD had said when he sent him, and about all the signs he had been commanded to perform.

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel:
verses.ct: Then Moses and Aaron went together and assembled all the elders of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And Aaron spake all the words which the LORD had spoken unto Moses, and did the signs in the sight of the people.
verses.ct: Aaron repeated everything the LORD had told Moses, and he performed the signs in front of the people.

verses.kjv: And the people believed: and when they heard that the LORD had visited the children of Israel, and that he had looked upon their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshipped.
verses.ct: The people believed. When they heard that the LORD had come to the Israelites and had seen their suffering, they bowed their heads and worshiped.
